_header: As of honey men gatheren oft sweetness
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Song of Vertu’ — thirteen 8-line stanzas with refrain, ‘Who sueth vertu vertu he shall lere’

BodAsh59.First Lines:
…Off Rethoricyens men lerne ffresshe languageOff holy saintes
                    procedith parfitnesOff ffurious folke Debate and OuterageOf marcyall
                    prynces vertuous highe noblesse…
BodAsh59.Last Lines:
…Cleyme of his mercy to haue possessionWith hym to dwell aboue
                    the sterris Clere
BodAsh59.Note: Stanzas 1-5 missing due to loss of folio.

BodRawC86.First Lines:
Off hony men gaderen out swetnesseOf wyne & spisus is made good
                    Ipocrase…
BodRawC86.Last Lines:
…Cleyme of his mercy to haue possessionWyth hym to dwell aboue
                    þe sterres cleere

CULKk16.First Lines:
As of hony men gadren swetnesseOf wyne and spices is made god
                    ypocras…
CULKk16.Last Lines:
…Cleyme of mercy to haue possessiounWith hym to dwell above
                    þe sterrys clere
CULKk16.Attributed Title:
Here…begynneth a songe of vertu of þe seyde John Lydgatis makyng
                    (f. 203v); Here enduth the songe on þis worde who sueth vertu
                    vertu schall he leere (f. 205v)

CamJes56.First Lines:
[A]s of hony men gadre out swetnesOf wyne and spices is maade goode
                    ypocras…
CamJes56.Last Lines:
…Cleyme of his mercye to haue possessionWith hym to dwell a
                    boue þe sterrys clere

CamTCC601.First Lines:
Of hony men gadyr out swetnesseOf wyne and spyses ys made
                    ypocrasffro syluyr wellys that boyle vp with fresshnesseCommyth
                    crystall rennyng a gret pas…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…Clayme of hys mercy to haue possessyowneWith hym to dwelle
                    aboue the sterres clere

BLHar2251.First Lines:
AS of hony men gete oft swetnesOf wyne and spicis is maad
                    ypocras…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…Clayme of his mercy to have possessiounWith hym to dwelle
                    above the sterris cliere
BLHar2251.Note: Three extra stanzas between stanzas 4 and 5.

BLHar2255.First Lines:
As of hony men gadren out swetnesseOf wyn and spices is maad good
                    ypocras…
BLHar2255.Last Lines:
…Cleyme of his mercy to haue possessionWith hym to dwelle
                    above the sterrys cleere Explict

HunHM140.First Lines:
As of hony men geder out swetnesseOf wyn and spices is made good
                    ypocras…
HunHM140.Last Lines:
…Cleyme of his mercy to haue possessiounWith hym to dwell
                    aboue þe sterris clere
